metadata.title: CVE-2020-25125 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: GnuPG 2.2.21 and 2.2.22 (and Gpg4win 3.1.12) has an array overflow, leadingto a crash or possibly unspecified other impact, when a victim imports anattacker's OpenPGP key, and this key has AEAD preferences. The overflow iscaused by a g10/key-check.c error. NOTE: GnuPG 2.3.x is unaffected. GnuPG2.2.23 is a fixed version.

criterions.comment: gnupg2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
